metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5287 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
A potentially exploitable use-after-free crash during actor destructionwith service workers. This issue does not affect releases earlier thanFirefox 49. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 49.0.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5287` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 49.0.2+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 49.0.2+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 49.0.2+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 49.0.2+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '49.0.2+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
